text: is a former Japanese football player. She played for the Japan national team. ==Biography== Niwata was born in Osaka Prefecture on September 12, 1984. In 2000, she was promoted to Speranza FC Takatsuki from the youth team. In 2007, she moved to Urawa Reds. She retired end of 2012 season. She played 96 matches in Nadeshiko League and she was selected Best Eleven 2 times (2009 and 2010).Urawa Reds In August 2002, Niwata was selected the Japan U-20 national team for 2002 U-19 World Championship. On March 19, 2003, she debuted for the Japan national team against Thailand. ==Statistics== Japan Football Association Japan national team Year Apps Goals 2003 1 0 Total 1 0 ==References== Category:1984 births Category:Living people Category:Footballers from Osaka Prefecture Category:Japan women's international footballers Category:Nadeshiko League players Category:Speranza Osaka-Takatsuki players Category:Urawa Red Diamonds Ladies players
title: Akiko Niwata
